intro: Stigmaphyllon angulosum, commonly known as the angular stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include palmate leaves with serrated edges and capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Stigmaphyllon angulosum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
